reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Increasing access to food security for women and men of Host Communities and IDPs in Idleb through integrated activities.

description.narrative: ONSUR’s proposed intervention seeks to improve the resilience of vulnerable IDPs and host communities in Idleb by integrated livelihood and food security activities The project design is based on the following: This project aims to increase the food security and enhancing the livelihoods of 5800 HHs (8352 women, 5568 men, 9744 boys, 11136 girls) IDPs and host communities in Idleb Governorate (Idleb District) Bennsh, Teftnaz, Sarmin, Maaret Tamsrin and, Salqin, subdistricts through: In the 2021-2022 season, 600 farmer HHs [including 864women, 576men, 1008 boys, 1152 girls consisting of 85% host communities and 15% IDPs] in Bennsh (Bennsh, Toum), Teftnaz (Teftnaz, Shallakh, Ketyan), Sarmin, Maaret Tamsrin (Zardana Mashehad) sub-districts will be provided with agricultural inputs through a voucher scheme. The scheme is to provide 200 kg Azote Fertilizer (Urea 46%) covering 10 donum for each HH, one fuel voucher (125 USD) for supplementary irrigation and one harvest voucher (50 USD) accompanied by related extension services. Additionally, ONSUR field team will follow-up the project activities during the life cycle of the wheat crop. -Marketing Phase: At this phase, which coincides supporting the marketing of wheat through purchase of 1 MT of wheat seed in the ongoing harvest season from each of the 600 supported farmers that equal 600 MT in total. The complementary budget proposed by ONSUR will procure 300 MT wheat from their budget, while SCHF requests 300 MT. -Processing Phase: ONSUR will contract with mill to grind 450 MT of wheat seed with 80% extract rate, and 20% wheat bran. The produced flour will be 360 MT and about 90 MT of wheat bran. 50 % (45 MT) of bran will give for mill owner as cost of wheat grinding, while the rest of bran (45MT) will sell to replace/purchase by wheat flour (The rest of bran 45 MT will replace/purchase by 22.5 MT of flour) (each 10 MT of bran will replaced by 5 MT of flour). In total (360+22.5= 382.5 MT of flour) we will obtain 382.5 MT of flour. ONSUR will contract with two bakeries based on their capacities to bake 382.5 MT of flour producing the estimated weight of the bread will be 439.9 Ton (1Mt of flour produces 1.15 ton of bred). 10574 free bread bundle (800g/ for each 4 person of family/6 days a week) will distribute to 4600 IDPs HHs (involving 6624 women, 4416 men, 7728 boys and 8832 girls) in Salqin camps for 52 days through two months. As a complementation, ONSUR is to provide bread for 4600 families residing in 26 camps in Salqin through an ongoing project funded by a private donor. The project is going to end on June 30 ـ 2022. - ONSUR will sift the rest of purchased wheat seed (150 MT) to produce 135 MT of clean-good seeds. The seeds will be then sterilized and distributed among other 600 wheat farmers during 2022-2023. agricultural seasons. Each farmer will receive 225 kg of seeds to cultivate 10 donum in (Idleb-Teftnaz-(Teftnaz, Shallakh, Ketyan), Sarmin (Sarmin), Bennsh-(Bennsh, Toum), Maaret Tamsrin (Zardanna Mashehed), ONSUR will identify, verify for target beneficiaries according to eligibility criteria (Families who planted wheat this season 2021-2022). in addition to, vulnerability criteria. All the people in the targeted villages and markets will benefit directly/indirectly from the project, which makes the wheat products available in the markets at good prices. Furthermore, this intervention will improve the capacity of 4600 HHs IDPs who can’t afford bread due to poverty and lack of enough bakeries or bread distribution points. ONSUR will be committed to the FSL cluster and WHO recommendations on prevention measures related to COVID-19 especially during the distribution of bread and agricultural inputs and conduction of trainings. In addition, protection cluster recommendations will be taken into consideration to avoid any GBV/PSEA risk.
